content: I'm getting ready to apply a zulip server upgrade. Please speak up if this is a bad time!
@Josh Mandel it would not impact me but the content deadline for the ballot is Monday, what happens if it blows up? Would it be possible to wait until Monday or is it necessary to roll out today?
Waiting 'til Monday sounds like a fine plan!
Content deadline is actually the 10th - Wednesday. So Thursday would be even better :)
pubs_schedule_2016.pdf
sorry Lloyd, final content deadline is Sunday night (or Monday morning)
That's not the FHIR schedule
I'm still planning to update the server to zulip 1.3.13 (from 1.3.10). In theory it should be a quick process. (Or the server will go down in flames.) Objections to my running this now?
I'll share status updates at https://gist.github.com/jmandel/9911daea823f9227f4c8f671cd08935c in case things take longer than 5min.
Back?
Sorry the server has been flaky -- still debugging. On the plus side, we now have :fhir:
Or
The chat server will be undergoing an infrastructure upgrade this evening. Please expect some downtime.
Thanks Hussain

Anytime, Grahame :)
The chat server is now back up and running (the server has been provisioned to a better performing VM).
yay thanks
zulip is double-sending the 'while you've been gone' emails to me

I'm getting the same thing, but I thought it might be realted to us having 2 e-mail addresses on Zulip ie @nehta.gov.au and now @digitalhealth.gov.au . I wasn't able to find a place on Zulip to turn-off the @nehta.gov.au email address off.
However, the double-sending "while you were out" seems to have started on the 7th Aug 2016, so it might be related to the Zulip upgrade or Zulip change?
I'm getting the same double-emails
I'm going to upgrade our server's zulip version â€” should be back up in a few moments (famous last words).
Update log at: https://gist.github.com/jmandel/279e759fea8c9d1864cecd55f8799e08
Back!

Among other updates:

1) Our server is now compatible with the Zulip mobile clients (use https://chat.fhir.org as your server when signing up)
2) There's a streams search feature (magnifying glass to the right of "streams" in the left-side bar)
3) You can only edit your messages for a fixed length of time (not forever). This is configurable, but I think it should help keep us sane.
great stuff!
Awesome, mobile just works!
Teste
I'm going to upgrade the Zulip server to the latest release (v1.6).
Upgrade log at https://gist.github.com/jmandel/56f6192170f74af46a2910bc06d251d1 in case any issues arise...
OK, we're back!
(Commit hooks won't auto-link to svn revisions yet; I need to update that piece, but the lack of it shouldn't get in anyone's way. If that's not true, let me know!)
For release notes, see http://blog.zulip.org/2017/06/06/zulip-server-1-6-released/

Features I'd like to highlight include:

  • You can now update your e-mail address and other account settings from https://chat.fhir.org/#settings/your-account
  • Extensive new keyboard shortcuts including + to respond with and n to cycle through unread streams/topics
  • Support for push messages on android (should be working by Monday) and, later on, iOS
  • Performance enhancements that should make our user sidebar snappier by limiting to users with recent activity
A big shout-out to @Tim Abbott and the Zulip team for this jam-packed release!
Push notifications on Android are now working! If you are using the Android client you will need to sign out and sign back in again before this works.

o/ Heads up I'm about to experiment running a bi-directional tunnel bot to chat.zulip.org in a '<- chat.zulip.org' topic in '#social' stream. Let me know ASAP when it becomes too spammy (tho feel free to say/ask anything to chat.zulip.org!), then i'll shut the bot.

FYI in about 5 hours we'll be updating Zulip to the latest release (1.7, published 2 weeks ago -- details at https://github.com/zulip/zulip/releases/tag/1.7.0). We'll expect a bit of downtime here, which I'll announce when the time comes.
Added OpsGenie, Google Code-In, Google Search, and xkcd integrations.
Yeah, that should definitely come in handy!
@xkcd 927
.. guess we need to turn that on somewhere
I have a feeling that will be a popular one
Apparently, Grahame is preapplying the update.
duh
OK, I'm going to start the upgrade now.
Will keep a log at https://gist.github.com/jmandel/5b7a0ef3fe1be41da53fff0d9fcf8fbd
@xkcd 927
Done! Note that nobody is hosting the xkcd bot for us, so this won't work yet :-)
hah ok well it was worth a try
thnks for doing the upgrade
sure! And we'll get XKCD working, never fear :p
@xkcd 927
@xkcd 927

#927: Standards
Fortunately, the charging one has been solved now that we've all standardized on mini-USB. Or is it micro-USB? Shit.
yay thanks
Quick reminder that discussion of announcements should be on Social :)
(deleted)

xkcd bot only supports these commands, not 'password':

  • @xkcd help to show this help message.
  • @xkcd latest to fetch the latest comic strip from xkcd.
  • @xkcd random to fetch a random comic strip from xkcd.
  • @xkcd <comic id> to fetch a comic strip based on <comic id> e.g @xkcd 1234.
@Lynn Laakso <comic id>?
@Lynn Laakso https://xkcd.com/
(deleted)
Upgrading zulip to the latest 1.8 release (http://blog.zulip.org/2018/04/18/zulip-1-8-released/) -- should be back shortly.

I'm going to be upgrading chat.fhir.org to the latest Zulip release; should be back online shortly. (Note this is a preliminary step before moving to a new server hosted by the delightful team at zulip.org)
Upgrade status: https://gist.github.com/jmandel/fb1e862e81e846f4b7364afbc5384a42
And we're back. Note there will be some more downtime in the next couple of days as we migrate the server; will announce here.

Thanks for bearing with us through the last couple of hours of downtime; we're still not quite ready to do a server migration, so there will be a bit more downtime coming (likely tomorrow) once we get our data in shape for the transition.

Okay, today we're going to make the transfer over to a new server. I'm going to be taking the site down now to begin this process; will send an email to the FHIR mailing list (see http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=FHIR_email_list_subscription_instructions) with updates.

Out of curiosity, is it expected that links to topics change over time? I can't tell if this happened post-upgrade or at some other point, but a few of our external links into zulip were broken (I haven't done the diff to see if all were broken). I came in and found threads manually, so they're still there...
Looks like the Zulip server upgrade has broken links to streams...?
Discussion on #social please
Discussion of zulip upgrade: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179160-social/topic/zulip.20upgrade
